Package org.UI

Class Context

java.lang.Object
org.UI.Context
public class Context extends Object
Context class manages the interaction between user inputs, business logic, and various manager classes. It serves as a controller that processes user actions and coordinates between different modules of the application.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Context(user currentUser, List<GenericManager<user>> managersList)
    Constructs a new Context associated with the specified user.

  • Constructor Details

    • Context

      public Context(user currentUser, List<GenericManager<user>> managersList)
      Constructs a new Context associated with the specified user. Initializes all manager classes needed for handling different actions.
      Parameters:
      currentUser - the user for which this context is created
      managersList - List of the Managers

  • Method Details

    • endContext

      public void endContext()
      Terminates the current context by saving all modified data. Saves enquiries, applications, and projects to their respective storage locations.

    • act

      public List<String> act(String action, Scanner sc)
      Processes a user action based on the action type and handles user input/output. This method serves as the main controller for all user interactions with the system.
      Parameters:
      action - the action to be performed (e.g., "view-enquiries", "submit-enquiry", etc.)
      sc - the Scanner object for reading user input
      Returns:
      a List of strings representing the output/response to be displayed to the user

    • getCurrentUser

      public user getCurrentUser()
      Returns the current user associated with this context.
      Returns:
      the user object
